sentences.english: Over the next few years, the couple worked, raised their children—Isabel andEli, who were seven and ten years old when their grandfather moved in—and cared for Winokur’s father.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们的祖父搬来时他们分别有7岁和10岁。

sentences.english: His grandfather lies in the churchyard.
sentences.chinese: 他祖父葬于教堂的墓地。

sentences.english: Last weekend, we called on our grandparents.
sentences.chinese: 上周末，我们拜望了祖父母。

sentences.english: My grand-father was always buying himself new suits of clothes, it was a foible of his.
sentences.chinese: 我祖父经常给自己买新衣服，这是他的毛病。

sentences.english: There are six people in my family counting my grandfather and grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 我家里连祖父母算在内有六口人。

sentences.english: Albertha, watching from the doorway, cried out and ran to stop him.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔韦塔在门口看到后，呼喊着跑去阻止祖父。

sentences.english: He has made a walking stick for his grandfather from the bamboo pole.
sentences.chinese: 他用这根竹杆给他祖父做了根手杖。

sentences.english: After grandpa croaked, I inherited his pickup truck.
sentences.chinese: 祖父过世后我继承了他的小卡车。

sentences.english: I had no grandparent to stand proudly for me.
sentences.chinese: 没有祖父母会为我自豪地站起来。
我最喜爱的“父亲”“祖父”演绎者。

sentences.english: He went on to explain that his grandparents needed help on the weekends.
sentences.chinese: 接着他解释道，他的祖父母周末需要人帮助。

sentences.english: Grandpa is really cranky if he doesn’t have his afternoon nap.
sentences.chinese: 祖父如果不睡午觉就会很暴躁。

sentences.english: His grandfather noticed that he would often improvise melodies as he played with his toys.
sentences.chinese: 他的祖父注意到他在玩玩具时常常即兴哼出旋律来。

sentences.english: "That sheep is the grandfather of all the best pedigree Dolans in the region, " said Mr Liu.
sentences.chinese: 这头羊是当地所有良种刀郎羊的祖父。

sentences.english: The master switch was fixed in grandpa's room.
sentences.chinese: 但是总电门是安在祖父的屋里的。

definition: father's elder brother/term of respect for older man/CL:個|个[ge4]
Zhangzi county in Shanxi 山西[Shan1 xi1]
